jobs.title: AI Scout
jobs.description_full:
About the job

AI Scout - Commission-Based Partnership




Kerzie AI Solutions | Remote | Flexible | 1099 Contractor




HOW TO APPLY




Visit: https://kerzieconsulting.com/ai-scout-opportunity




Click the "Apply Now" button and fill out the application form to apply.




ABOUT THE ROLE:




Kerzie AI Solutions is building a network of AI Scouts - driven individuals who identify Small businesses struggling with customer communication and connect them with Unison, our AI-powered solution that handles phone calls, texts, website chat/voice, and social media channels from a single knowledge base.




This is not a traditional sales job. You are a scout - someone who spots opportunity before others do. You find the HVAC company whose calls go to voicemail after 5pm. The dental office drowning in appointment requests. The property manager who cannot keep up with tenant inquiries. You get the contract signed; we handle the rest.




How you find businesses is up to you. Tap your existing network, join a business networking group, cold call, knock on doors, run ads, leverage social media, attend local events - whatever works. We care about results, not methods.




Success in this role looks like: Building a portfolio of 15+ clients generating $2,900+/month in recurring commission, while helping small businesses deliver consistent customer experiences around the clock. There is no ceiling on this. You can do the math to see what your exit from the 9-5 treadmill looks like if that is your goal. This can also be a lucrative side hustle. This is different for every scout. The opportunity is there if you want it. 




How this fits into Kerzie AI: Scouts are our frontline growth engine. While our team focuses on building and delivering Unison, you are out in the world finding the businesses who need it most. As we scale toward 300 clients, scouts who get in early will build substantial recurring income streams.




COMMISSION STRUCTURE




Here is where this opportunity is different from anything you will find in corporate America.




Most sales roles pay you once and move on. Maybe you get a small residual for a quarter or two. Then it is back to zero, chasing the next deal just to stay employed.




This is a monthly recurring commission structure - and it is virtually unheard of at these rates:




1-2 contracts: 20%

3-9 contracts: 35%

10+ contracts: 50%




Example earnings at $500/month per client:

- 5 clients = $725/month recurring

- 10 clients = $1,675/month recurring

- 20 clients = $4,175/month recurring




IMPORTANT: THIS IS A 1099 CONTRACTOR POSITION




This is not a W-2 employee role. You are an independent contractor. There is no base salary, no hourly wage, and no guaranteed income. Your earnings are 100% commission-based, determined entirely by the contracts you bring in.




That said, the upside is real: every contract you sign generates monthly recurring income for as long as that customer continues paying for Unison. You are not building someone else's book of business - you are building your own.




RESPONSIBILITIES




- Get Unison contracts signed




- Identify small and mid-sized businesses that struggle with customer communication (missed calls, slow response times, lost leads, inconsistent messaging across channels)




- Acquire leads through any method you choose - networking groups, cold outreach, social media, local events, referrals, or creative approaches we have not thought of




- Understand businesses current communication challenges




- Qualify leads by assessing fit for Unison




- Introduce qualified prospects to the Kerzie AI team for onboarding




- Maintain relationships with referred clients to identify additional opportunities and gather feedback




- Track your pipeline and referrals using provided tools and systems




WHAT WE PROVIDE




You do not need to be an AI expert. You do not need to know how to build automations. We will train you on everything you need to know - how to talk to business owners about Unison, how to explain automation in simple terms, and how to identify the pain points that make a business a great fit. You show up ready to learn and hustle; we will make sure you are prepared to get contracts signed.




QUALIFICATIONS




Required:




- Strong interpersonal and communication skills - you are comfortable starting conversations with business owners




-Experienced in B2B sales or consulting




- Self-motivated with the ability to work independently without daily supervision




- Coachable - willing to learn how we talk about AI and automation so you can confidently represent Unison




- Resourcefulness in finding and reaching potential clients through whatever channels work for you




- Reliable internet access and smartphone




Preferred:




- Familiarity with local business communities (Existing network, Chamber of Commerce, BNI, industry associations, etc.)




- Understanding of how small businesses operate - their challenges, constraints, and priorities




Not Required:




- Technical background or coding experience




- AI expertise or experience building automations - we teach you everything you need to know




- Full-time availability - You choose how much time you would like to invest in this opportunity.




ABOUT KERZIE AI SOLUTIONS




Kerzie AI Solutions helps small businesses deliver consistent, high-quality customer communication across every channel - 24/7. Our flagship product, Unison, combines telecom expertise with applied AI to handle phone calls, website chat/voice, SMS, and social media channel inquiries from a unified knowledge base.




We believe every business deserves the customer communication infrastructure of a Fortune 500 company. Unison makes that possible at $500/month with no hidden fees or per-message charges.




Learn more about Kerzie AI and Unison: https://kerzie.ai




HOW TO APPLY




Visit: https://kerzieconsulting.com/ai-scout-opportunity




Click the "Apply Now" button and fill out the application form to apply.

jobs.title: Don't see a role that fits? Apply here!
jobs.description_full:
About the job

Who We Are:

At Formic, we're on a mission to revolutionize American manufacturing and create more abundance in the world. We believe in continuing the American legacy of innovation by making automation accessible to all manufacturers and increasing their factory productivity by 10x.

Built upon deep expertise in robotics and manufacturing, our unique full service automation solutions combine the best automation technology, software, and analysis tools for manufacturers with best in class uptime, support, and maintenance services. We are creating a new era of supercharged efficiency and competitiveness for US manufacturers.

As the world faces growing pressure from tariffs, rising costs, and labor shortages, Formic is uniquely positioned as the industry leading solution to overcome these challenges. Fueled by our vision for a re-industrialized domestic supply chain, everything we do is aimed at growing "Made in America" products. And we're growing fast - achieving 7x growth in production hours YoY.

Supporting us in our mission, with investments thus far totaling over $60 million, are backers including Lux Capital, Initialized Capital, Blackhorn Ventures, Mitsubishi HC Capital NA, and CEOs and founders of multiple Fortune 50 companies.

We are always looking for people who are passionate about robotics and automation, motivated to do impactful work, and inspired by our mission to change the way the world makes... well, everything. If you believe you can contribute to our team, let us know. We'll reach out if we have the right opportunity for you.

Our Total Rewards

At Formic, we believe you perform your best when you're supported in caring for yourself and your loved ones. That's why we've thoughtfully designed a comprehensive benefits and perks package for our full-time, U.S.-based team members, including:


Equity in Formic: Own a meaningful stake in a fast-growing Series A startup, backed by leading global investors 
Competitive Commission Structure: Commission plans shared upon onboarding, for commission-eligible roles 
Comprehensive Healthcare Coverage: 99% covered Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans, with 75% coverage for dependents, provided by Blue Cross Blue Shield and Guardian 
Additional Fully Covered Insurance Benefits: FSA & DCFSA, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability through Guardian, all 100% employer-paid 
Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Fully funded by Formic and provided via Guardian, offering support when you need it most 
Paid Parental Leave: Generous parental leave to support our employees and their growing families 
Company-sponsored 401(k): Invest in your future with our company-backed retirement savings plan 
Home Office Stipend: A one-time allowance for fully remote employees to set up your ideal at-home or on the road work environment 
Monthly Cell-Phone Reimbursement: Monthly stipend toward phone and internet expenses 
Flexible Time-Off: Take the time you need, when you need it, supported by our flexible PTO policy 
Paid Company Holidays: Celebrate important dates with paid time off 


Compensation Philosophy

Formic's compensation packages - including salaries and equity - are thoughtfully benchmarked against peer companies at a similar growth stage. Equity represents a critical part of our mutual investment: when Formic succeeds, so do you.

Final compensation packages are carefully customized based on candidate preference for cash and equity balance, experience, geographic location, and market considerations. Our goal is to attract and reward top talent who will significantly impact our organization. We're open to meaningful discussions about compensation structure to secure exceptional team members.

What we look for: 

We're building a company from the ground up, so every single person we hire has a massive impact on our team, culture, and ability to accomplish our mission. While each individual brings their own unique skills and perspectives to Formic, we look for people who share our vision and act in alignment with our Operating Principles. If this sounds like you, Formic could be the place for you!


Fearless Optimism: You share our ambitious vision of what we can accomplish. You're aware of the challenges we will face as a startup doing new things in an old space, but you're energized by the incredible opportunity we have to drive change for our customers, and for the manufacturing industry at large.
Factories First: You have a strong customer focus, no matter who your customer is. You seek to make things easier and better for our customers, even if it makes your job a little harder. 
Today, Not Tomorrow: There are always plenty of projects to tackle in a startup, but you prioritize, take accountability for work, and have a bias toward action.
Be Right Often: You don't do things just because that's how they've always been done. You keep looking for ways to improve, seek out feedback along the way, and back your decisions up with data. 
Made of Rubber: Just like rubber, when you fall you bounce back up. You know there's going to be a lot of challenge and change in our work ahead but you are adaptable, resilient, and ready to thrive through it all.
Good Baton Passes: You work with a desire to make things easier and better for your team members. You use empathy to understand the needs and goals of others and support each other so Formic can be successful together. 


Equal Opportunity

Formic is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion or religious creed, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, marital status, family or parental status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. All employment decisions are based on a person's merit, business needs, and role requirements. If you require further accommodations or have questions regarding accessibility of our roles, please reach out to careers@formic.co.

AI Use

At Formic, fairness and transparency are at the heart of our hiring process. We use AI-powered tools in some interviews to help our teams evaluate candidate responses, but all final hiring decisions are made by humans. You can learn more about how AI is used in our recruitment process by reviewing our AI Hiring Disclosure linked here.


Important Notice on Recruitment Scams 


Formic has been made aware of fraudulent outreach claiming to represent Formic through various scam or phishing attempts. Please note that all communications from Formic will come from a verified @formic.co email address or verified LinkedIn account. Formic will never ask you to download unsolicited documents, schedule interviews via third parties without prior application, or share personal or financial information. If you receive suspicious outreach, please disregard it and report it to careers@formic.co.

jobs.title: AI Software Engineer Intern
jobs.description_full:
About the job

Why Praxent?

We get it. You have options. Let us tell you why we're different. Our work is changing the world of financial services. Everyday, clients arrive with big ideas for their industry. They're experts in their field with the vision and resources you need to change everything. All that's left is the right team to bring that vision to life. If you're a fast learner and you love working on a wide variety of projects, you're going to like it here. We help our clients modernize, rather than rebuild, outdated customer-facing software applications. Our clients see a return within weeks instead of months and that's why they choose us.

At Praxent, we let you do your work your way. We're a team of 170+ located throughout the United States and Central/South America. Our role is to encourage you, support you, and give you the freedom you need to thrive. Whether you're working at home, in a coffee shop, or heck, even on your travels, we're here to create an environment that lets you live your best life. On your terms.

We trust our people to be their best. It's a level of autonomy and respect that's helped us grow a diverse and brilliant team of experts. Experts who also happen to be some of the best colleagues you've ever worked alongside.

The Details:

Location: Remote, with a presence in Austin, Texas for some in person collaboration.

Duration: This is a limited term role 15-20 hours per week, predicted to begin March 1, 2026 and last through July 21, 2026 with the opportunity to extend into a full-time position.

Process:


Introductory Screen + Light Technical Assessment: ~ 45 minute Video Interview with our AI powered recruiter, Alex. This helps ensure we're providing a fair process for all.
Final Interview: ~ 75 minute Combined Interview with our Director of AI and Technology and another AI Engineering team member.


The Program:

As an AI Software Engineering Intern at Praxent, you will be a vital part of our mission to integrate AI seamlessly into legacy software modernization projects, our client's platforms, and our overall agentic SDLC. Your role involves collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and client success, to understand the unique challenges faced by our clients and translate these insights into innovative proofs of concept and AI development tools.

You will embrace a hands-on approach to experimentation and iteration, contributing to the creation of actionable AI strategies that align with our clients' business objectives. By developing agentic AI tools such as prompts, templates, commands, and hooks/skills, you will help streamline the integration of AI technologies, driving efficiency and enhancing the quality of deliverables.

As you engage in iterative processes, your commitment to quality oversight and attention to detail will ensure that our projects maintain high standards of completeness and consistency. You will also play a role in fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team, actively participating in knowledge-sharing initiatives to elevate our collective expertise in AI advancements.

Through your contributions, Praxent will further establish itself as a trusted partner for organizations looking to harness the transformative power of AI. Your work will not only lead to successful project outcomes but also enhance client satisfaction and support sustained business growth, ultimately positioning Praxent as a leader in the evolving landscape of financial technology.

Development of Proofs of Concept (PoCs)


Support implementation of innovative PoCs that demonstrate the practical applications of AI in modernizing legacy systems or integrating AI into software solutions. Collaborate with senior engineers to conceptualize, design, operate and execute PoCs.
Utilize AI models to simulate enhancements and document findings.


Development of AI Tools


Work from a defined backlog to develop prompts, templates, commands, hooks/skills, and other tools to support AI initiatives.
Participate in our AI Center of Excellence brainstorming sessions to identify essential tools for AI workflow efficiency. Iterate on feedback from team members to refine tools and templates.
Help source tooling and AI-enabled needs from delivery teams.


Iterative Experimentation and Improvement


 Engage in experimentation to improve AI outputs and processes.
Conduct experiments using different AI models and configurations. Analyze results and document insights for future reference.
Collect and share within our AI Center of Excellence through regular presentations of experimental findings, directly resulting in measurable improvements to AI output consistency.


Tool Chain Set-Up


Configure and deploy project-specific AI toolchains. Act as the "Tooling Architect" for specific projects, selecting and configuring the right sequence of AI agents and development utilities to bridge the gap between legacy codebases and modern environments. 


Technical Competencies


Foundational AI Literacy: Ability to understand and apply basic AI concepts—such as how Large Language Models work, LLM harnesses like Claude Code, and the principles of RAG—to solve simple automation tasks or data queries.
Logic-Based Data Mapping: Ability to analyze structured and semi-structured data from legacy sources to identify patterns and relationships, ensuring that information is accurately translated and formatted for use within AI-driven applications.
Pragmatic Scripting Skills: Experience in a core language like Python or TypeScript to write clean, functional scripts that automate data handling and connect different software components.
Creative Prompt Design: Capability to iteratively experiment with and refine structured AI prompts to achieve desired outcomes, demonstrating a blend of logical thinking and clear communication. Test and improvement of prompts
Technical Curiosity & Adaptability: A strong drive to explore new AI tools, libraries, and frameworks, with the ability to quickly learn and apply them to specific project challenges as they arise.
Detail-Oriented Debugging: Ability to systematically test code and AI outputs, identifying inconsistencies or errors and working collaboratively to refine the logic until it meets quality standards.


The hourly range for this role is $15 per hour.

jobs.title: AI Community Moderator (EST)
jobs.description_full:
About the job

Community Moderator - AI Advantage

Location: Remote in the United States (EST preferred)

Schedule: Full-time in EST (40 hours/week) + occasional weekend coverage for live events

Salary: $45,000-$50,000




To Apply: Please review the entire job description and follow the application instructions under the HOW TO APPLY section. 




ABOUT THE AI ADVANTAGE




Founded by Tony Robbins, Dean Graziosi, and Igor Pogany, AI Advantage exists to help everyday entrepreneurs, professionals, and business owners use AI confidently to reclaim their time and amplify their results. We're building the best AI education community in the world for beginners and intermediates—cutting through the confusion and making AI simple, practical, and powerful for regular people.




Our mission: Help people create real leverage in their personal and professional lives so they can get time and energy back to do the things they love.







THE ROLE




As a Community Moderator, you are the heartbeat of the AI Advantage experience. You'll be the first point of contact for our members, providing lightning-fast support, fostering genuine connections, and ensuring every member feels valued and empowered.




This role requires a very special kind of person: You're a natural people-person who genuinely loves serving others and pouring value into their lives. You find deep satisfaction in helping members succeed, answering their questions with warmth, and being a steady, reliable presence they can count on. While AI education is part of the work, you thrive in a role where consistency matters—where showing up with the same exceptional care and attention every single day is what creates extraordinary member experiences.




When you're on shift, you're 100% dedicated to our members—this is your sole focus.







WHAT YOU'LL DO




Be the Front Line of Member Experience

Respond to member questions and comments within minutes across all community channels
Moderate live events, training sessions, and ongoing discussions with warmth and professionalism
Proactively engage members to foster connection and maintain a welcoming environment




Build Relationships That Matter

Handle conversations across multiple community spaces (forums, live events, DMs, channels)
Conduct thoughtful 1:1 DM conversations to understand member needs and goals
De-escalate concerns with empathy and professionalism
Identify natural opportunities to guide members toward higher-tier offerings when appropriate




Master the Content

Stay current on all community resources: guides, hacks of the week, live trainings, and AI tools
Direct members to the right resources quickly and accurately
Translate AI concepts into accessible, practical guidance for beginners and intermediates




Maintain Excellence

Response Time: Reply within minutes during your shift
Response Quality: Deliver accurate, helpful, empathetic communication
Conversation Quality: Create meaningful interactions that build trust and loyalty




WHAT YOU BRING




Required:

2+ years of experience in customer-facing roles (customer success, community management, customer support, or similar)
2+ years actively using AI tools like ChatGPT, Claude, and other LLMs at a beginner-to-intermediate level (you don't need to be an expert, but you should be familiar with these tools and use them regularly)
Exceptional written communication: Clear, warm, and professional—with impeccable grammar
High EQ: You read between the lines, sense what people need, and adapt your approach naturally
Genuine love for serving people: You get energy from helping others succeed and find fulfillment in being a consistent, supportive presence
Ultra-responsive: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where quick, quality responses matter
Highly organized: Manage multiple conversations simultaneously without dropping the ball
Self-directed: Work independently and take ownership of your shift
Comfortable with consistency: You excel at delivering the same high standard of care day after day, finding meaning in the reliability and impact of your work




Preferred:

1+ years of experience in online education, e-learning, or EdTech environments (big plus!)
Previous experience in paid communities or subscription products
Coaching, training, or facilitation experience




COMPENSATION & BENEFITS




Salary Range: $40,000–$55,000 annually (based on experience and location)

Benefits: Health Insurance, PTO, 401k match. 




TIME ZONE REQUIREMENTS




We're hiring 1 moderator to provide the following coverage:




Eastern Time (EST/EDT)




You must be located in and available during core business hours for your respective time zone. Occasional weekend availability required for live events (typically 1-2x monthly).




WHY THIS ROLE




If you’re someone who is AI-fluent, genuinely excited about helping others learn and apply AI in practical ways, and energized by being on the front lines of an active, fast-moving online community - this role was built for you.




We’re looking for people who:




Naturally show up with warmth, clarity, and responsiveness
Enjoy translating complex tools into simple, usable guidance
Take pride in being a consistent, reliable presence for members
Stay curious and current with AI trends because you want to, not because you’re told to
Believe great community moderation is about serving first, building trust, and creating real momentum for people




If you want to grow with a brand at the intersection of AI, education, and real human impact, we’d love to hear from you.




📬 HOW TO APPLY




Email the following to andres@mastermind.com with the subject line:

“AI Community Moderator – [Your Name]”




Please include in your email: 

1️⃣ Resume

Highlight relevant experience in community moderation, customer support, education, or customer-facing roles (AI experience is a big plus).




2️⃣ Written Response (1–2 pages max)




Please respond thoughtfully to all three prompts below:




AI Fluency & Learning Habits - Which AI tools do you actively use today (e.g., ChatGPT, Claude, NotebookLM)? How do you stay current on AI updates, trends, or new use cases?
Community Moderation Experience - Describe your experience supporting or moderating online communities. Which platforms have you worked in (e.g., Circle, Skool, Slack, Discord), and what did great moderation look like in practice?
Value-First Member Support Scenario- Imagine a paid community member asks a question that’s partially answered in existing resources, but they’re clearly stuck. How would you respond in a way that delivers value first — and, if appropriate, naturally guides them toward a higher-level program without being salesy?




Final Note

We review applications carefully. Clear, thoughtful responses matter more than polished buzzwords. If this role resonates with how you naturally show up, we encourage you to apply.

jobs.title: General Interest Application
jobs.description_full:
About the job

Today, 67% of students and 82% of low-income students can’t read at grade level by the end of third grade. That’s when students are supposed to go from learning to read to reading to learn. It’s America’s number one education crisis and we know how to fix it.

Ignite Reading delivers one-to-one virtual tutoring that teaches every student the foundational skills they need to become a confident, fluent reader. We pair students who need extra support with expert reading tutors who provide daily, 15-minute, Science of Reading-based instruction that rapidly closes their decoding gaps. We focus on the foundational reading skills—phonics, phonemic awareness, and sight words—kids need to master so they can decode a sentence. Students in Ignite Reading’s program achieve over 2 weeks of reading skills growth per week of instruction, and notably all students achieve the same outstanding results including students with IEPs, multilingual learners, students of color and those receiving free or reduced-price lunch.

Ignite Reading is a mission-driven public benefit corporation. We believe we can do well for our team members and shareholders while we solve one of the nation’s biggest challenges. We believe we will be more successful with a diverse team and are seeking candidates who have lived experience related to social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion.

We understand that finding the right job opportunity can sometimes be challenging, and we don't want exceptional candidates like you to slip through the cracks. If you couldn't find an open position that precisely matches your profile, we encourage you to submit your resume through this General Interest Application.

By submitting your resume, you'll have the opportunity to be considered for future positions that align with your qualifications, even if they are not currently listed on our website.

We also ensure you have the tools to thrive both in and out of work. 

📈 Employee Stock Options - we want our success to be yours too

🩺 Medical, Dental, and Vision plans to support you and your well-being (80% employee coverage, 70% dependent coverage)

🏥 Short-term Disability (100% employer paid)

🏦 401(k) retirement plans with company contribution

👶 12 weeks paid parental leave (this includes adoptions)

🌴 Unlimited vacation days (+ 12 paid holidays)

💻 Laptop Stipend + Monthly Technology Stipend

🧘 Monthly Wellness Stipend

🛟 Voluntary Life Insurance

👩‍💻 Yearly Professional Development Stipend

🏢 Yearly Staff Retreat to connect, unwind, and celebrate all our hard work each year.

We believe in building and fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all applicants are considered for employment without attention to color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike majority candidates meeting significantly fewer requirements. We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested!

We are seeking candidates who have lived experience related to social justice, diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are a virtual organization with headquarters in the California Bay Area.

jobs.title: AI Engineer
jobs.description_full:
About the job

The AI Engineer will support the International Trade Administration (ITA) AI Center of Excellence (AI-CoE) by delivering end-to-end artificial intelligence solutions across the full system lifecycle. This role focuses on model development, data handling, deployment, optimization, and integration of AI capabilities within secure, cloud-based federal IT environments.


This position is contingent upon contract award.*


Job Duties And Responsibilities


 Design, develop, test, and deploy AI and machine learning models. 
 Manage data ingestion, preprocessing, validation, and feature engineering. 
 Build, deploy, and maintain AI infrastructure and pipelines. 
 Optimize model performance, scalability, and reliability. 
 Automate workflows and integrate AI solutions with enterprise systems. 
 Monitor models in production and implement continuous improvements. 
 Collaborate with product owners, developers, and data teams in SAFe Agile environments. 
 Ensure solutions align with federal security, compliance, and governance requirements. 
 Maintain technical documentation and operational runbooks. 
 Other duties as assigned. 


Job Requirements (Education/Skills/Experience)


 U.S. Citizenship (required). Ability to obtain and maintain a NACI or higher background investigation. 
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field (or equivalent experience). 
 Minimum 2 years experience 
 Experience across the AI system lifecycle including development and deployment. 
 Proficiency with machine learning frameworks and programming languages. 
 Experience working in Agile or SAFe delivery environments. 


Desired Qualifications


 Master’s degree in a technical field. 
 Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP). 
 Familiarity with MLOps, CI/CD pipelines, and automation tools. 
 Experience supporting federal or public-sector IT programs. 
 Knowledge of AI governance, ethics, and security best practices. 


Work Location: Remote preferred with occasional on-site support in Washington, DC, as required.

This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or for inquiring about, discussing, or disclosing information about compensation, or any other basis prohibited by law. We participate in E-Verify.

jobs.title: Entry-Level AI Generalist (No Experience Required)
jobs.description_full:
About the job

We are seeking motivated individuals who are curious about artificial intelligence and excited to learn how advanced AI models are built, evaluated, and improved. This project is designed for people who are early in their academic journey, exploring potential specialties, or simply eager to gain hands-on exposure to real-world AI development projects. No prior experience is required—what matters most is your willingness to learn, ask questions, and engage thoughtfully with new concepts.

In this project, you will interact directly with AI systems, review model outputs, follow clear task guidelines, and contribute to the creation of high-quality training data. You may work on activities such as evaluating responses, identifying inconsistencies, providing feedback, or helping structure information so that models learn more effectively. All tasks are well-defined, and you will receive guidance and examples to help you succeed as you build confidence over time.

You should be comfortable working independently, paying close attention to detail, and communicating clearly about what you observe. A thoughtful, reflective approach—explaining your reasoning and noting uncertainties—is highly valued, as it helps improve both the models and the training process. This project is well-suited for individuals who enjoy problem-solving, learning through practice, and contributing to innovative technology in a structured environment.

This project offers a unique opportunity to gain practical exposure to AI development without needing a technical background. You’ll develop transferable skills in critical thinking, evaluation, and structured communication while contributing to systems that are shaping the future of technology across many industries.

If you’re excited to learn, open to feedback, and interested in being part of the process that helps AI systems improve and evolve, this project provides a supportive entry point into the world of AI training and development.

We offer a pay range of $6-to- $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you’ll supply a secure computer and high‑speed internet; company‑sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

Project Title: Entry-Level AI Generalist (No Experience Required)

Contract Type: Freelance / Contract

Workplace type: Remote

jobs.title: AI Coach (Gemini)
jobs.description_full:
About the job

Correlation One Develops Workforce Skills For The AI Economy

Enterprises and governments work with us to develop talent and close critical data, digital, and technology skills gaps. Our global programs, including training programs and data competitions, also empower underrepresented communities and accelerate careers.

Our mission is to create equal access to the data-driven jobs of the future. We partner with top employers and government organizations to make that a reality, including Amazon, Coca-Cola, Johnson & Johnson, the U.S. State Department, and the U.S. Department of Defense.

Our skills training programs are 100% free for learners and are delivered virtually by industry experts to minimize traditional barriers to career advancement. We take pride in fostering supportive, human-led, group learning environments that build technical proficiency and confidence in participants.

Join us and let's shape the AI Economy together!

Program Details

Gemini 101 Workshop (~350 learners)


Feb 23 from 1 - 2:30pm ET


Gemini 201 Immersive Cohort (~50 learners)


Mar 6 from 10-11:30am ET 
Mar 12 from 10-11:30am ET 
Mar 20 from 10-11:30am ET 
Mar 27 from 10-11:30am ET


Apr 3 from 10-11:30am ET

Your impact 

As an AI Coach, you’ll play a critical role in guiding cross-functional commercial teams as they build and refine Gemini generative AI (GenAI) assistants to solve real business problems. Drawing on your experience in AI tools and business applications, you’ll support learners in designing assistant workflows, refining prompts, and connecting GenAI tools to strategic commercial processes—ultimately helping teams boost efficiency, improve revenue insights, and streamline decision-making.

Responsibilities


Coach teams through the development of Gemini GenAI assistants, with a focus on ideation, prototyping, and real-world testing.
Help learners refine prompts, assess assistant scalability, and build workflows that align with business goals.
Support teams in selecting and framing high-impact HR use cases and building localized, culturally relevant assistant applications.
Provide actionable feedback during Assistant Prototype Labs and dry-run sessions to prepare for final presentations.
Join live sessions and be available for team check-ins throughout the program, ensuring consistent support.
Help teams connect their work to business impact, productivity gains, enhanced insights, or improved decision-making.
Collaborate with the Program Manager and Lead Instructor to surface team needs, ensure timely deliverables, and troubleshoot blockers.


Your expertise


2+ years of experience applying Gemini GenAI tools to solve business problems or enhance workflows.
Strong background in prompt engineering, workflow design, or applied data analysis.
Ability to coach diverse teams through iterative assistant development and refinement.
Skilled in translating complex technical concepts into clear, strategic value propositions.
Experience in coaching, consulting, or facilitating training sessions, ideally in business or commercial contexts.
Understanding of key issues in assistant localization (e.g., tone, cultural fit, and content adaptation).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a learner-centered mindset.


Where you are


This role is remote and can be located anywhere that is compatible with the EST time zone. 


Correlation One’s Commitment 

Correlation One is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. Correlation One provides a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Employment decisions at Correlation One are based solely on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We encourage applicants to bring their unique skills, experiences, and outlook to our work environment.

Correlation One is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Correlation One strives to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidates@correlation-one.com.
